document.title: ISPS Modern Languages Standards And Benchmarks

jurisdiction.title: International School of Port of Spain

02F47B0C20A541A88EEB6A2745BDB26A.description: Understand that an idea may be expressed in multiple ways in the target language

7599E3C9111E4186B79D1A1D74F44EE7.description:
Understand that different languages use different patterns to communicate
and applies this knowledge to the target and native languages.

4C291FA79B5841C48391A960EC178A33.description: Use vocabulary and cultural expressions to express failure to understand the message or to request additional information (e.g., request that the speaker restates the message, ask appropriate questions for clarification).

E3373DD9322B484AAB9860BF11237A9F.description: Tell or write about products and/or practices on their own culture, such as, celebration, family events or foods.

F15975B26C5E462DBD8BF330C01B4B89.description: Use repetition, rephrasing and gesture effectively to assist in presenting oral reports or presentations.

177ED91864794A0D8F7870F75907AE0C.description: Use language conventions and style (e.g., phrases, structure, grammar, spelling, mechanics, commands, vocabulary, dialect, slang, idioms, humor, pronunciation, intonation, tone, stress) appropriate for different audiences (e.g., peers, adults), and settings(e.g., formal, informal, social, academic).

0D863A3C290D4B6BA3F7DDCC19D6B8F9.description: Know some elements of the sound and writing systems of the target language and how this element s differs from the same elements of one’s native language.

0CD70B5FEBE4427CB76EB1EA11B49CC0.description: Know words that have been borrowed from language to another.

EE9C0E8E0CC740D99157EBE419D2DB6B.description: Understand various phrase groupings and structures in spoken forms of the target language (e.g., expression, questions and polite commands).

FCA87BF436734924AE36295636ACCFDB.description: Understands oral and written descriptions of people and objects in the environment.

543B63C2EAA445CF87E506E3E77DA8CF.description: Understands common cognates and expressions in the target and native language.

81467689C9B0460E97F9A32FEE3B70DF.description:
Understand common phrase grouping and voice inflection in simple spoken
 sentences of familiar situations.

01CC12166C724E52A8370B2FCF2ADD26.description:
Understand traditional ideas & perspectives, institutions, professions,
literary & artistic expressions and other components of the target culture.

59CE24FB98C3487A8B9F54FE7028418C.description: Present information in the target language on topics of shared personal interest in one’s daily life at home or school (e.g., brief report to the class)

411C793E46A140FFAE06567E48BC9E69.description: Give oral and written oral presentations about family members and friends, objects present in the everyday environment and common school activities.

7026E29DE314432DA951BCF7C63AEAB9.description:
Use basic vocabulary to describe assorted objects (e.g., toys, dress, type of
 dwellings, food) in every day environments.

6733DE42AE734FF7A6B238028E27CF7F.description:
Present information, concepts & ideas to an audience of listeners or readers
on a variety of topics.

076819FDFCF842E887BAF87D4C9543FF.description: Understand spoken announcement of messages from peers and adults on a variety of familiar topics or topics of personal interest (e.g., favorite activities, school subjects)

5CB18D9C923D4AEFB51F6885D29FB4B5.description:
Understand the basic ideas of oral messages and short conversation based on
 simple or familiar topics appropriate at this developmental level (e.g., favorite
 activities, personal anecdotes, simple instructions).

77332BD97BE0404F8A5665BB3D186A5D.description:
Understand and interpret written and spoken language on diverse
topics from diverse media.

47CE7A1D89504173AADDFCBEB3A8BA12.description: Ask and answers questions in the target language (e.g., ask for assistance, answers question about self or family.)

6A7B647338834AE584291B9C7DFD450D.description:
Use appropriate vocabulary, gestures, and oral expressions for greetings,
introductions, leave takings, and other common or familiar interaction (e.g., exchanging
names, address, phone number, place of origin, general health/state of being; giving and
asking for permission; using the telephone; making and responding to a request)

37110E5CE5D342508C018804DF6E692C.description:
Use verbal communication to share personal data, information, and preferences
 (e.g., events in one’s life, significant details related to topics that are of common
 interest, preferred leisure activities, likes, dislikes and needs)

DFF9688E1D0C43F688E4EC25814725BC.description:
Use the target language to engage to communicate, express feelings
and emotions and exchange opinions and information.
